Expr is the abstract base class that defines the interface that all expression types must implement. More...

Detailed Description

Expr is the abstract base class that defines the interface that all expression types must implement.

Member Function Documentation

Symbol * Expr::GetBaseSymbol (  ) const [virtual]

For expressions that have values based on a symbol (e.g. regular symbol references, array indexing, etc.), this returns a pointer to that symbol.

Reimplemented in IndexExpr, MemberExpr, ReferenceExpr, DereferenceExpr, SymbolExpr, and FunctionSymbolExpr.

llvm::Constant * Expr::GetConstant ( const Type *  type ) const [virtual]

If this is a constant expression that can be converted to a constant of the given type, this method should return the corresponding llvm::Constant value. Otherwise it should return NULL.

Reimplemented in ExprList, and ConstExpr.

Definition at line 72 of file expr.cpp.

References NULL.

Referenced by Module::AddGlobal(), and DeclStmt::EmitCode().

llvm::Value * Expr::GetLValue ( FunctionEmitContext *  ctx ) const [virtual]

For expressions that can provide an lvalue (e.g. array indexing), this function should emit IR that computes the expression's lvalue and returns the corresponding llvm::Value. Expressions that can't provide an lvalue should leave this unimplemented; the default implementation returns NULL.

Reimplemented in IndexExpr, MemberExpr, DereferenceExpr, and SymbolExpr.

virtual llvm::Value* Expr::GetValue ( FunctionEmitContext *  ctx ) const [pure virtual]

This is the main method for Expr implementations to implement. It should call methods in the FunctionEmitContext to emit LLVM IR instructions to the current basic block in order to generate an llvm::Value that represents the expression's value.

Implemented in UnaryExpr, BinaryExpr, AssignExpr, SelectExpr, ExprList, FunctionCallExpr, IndexExpr, MemberExpr, ConstExpr, TypeCastExpr, ReferenceExpr, DereferenceExpr, SymbolExpr, FunctionSymbolExpr, and SyncExpr.

Referenced by FunctionEmitContext::CurrentLanesReturned(), ForStmt::EmitCode(), DoStmt::EmitCode(), IfStmt::EmitCode(), ExprStmt::EmitCode(), DereferenceExpr::GetLValue(), MemberExpr::GetLValue(), IndexExpr::GetLValue(), DereferenceExpr::GetValue(), TypeCastExpr::GetValue(), MemberExpr::GetValue(), IndexExpr::GetValue(), FunctionCallExpr::GetValue(), SelectExpr::GetValue(), AssignExpr::GetValue(), BinaryExpr::GetValue(), UnaryExpr::GetValue(), lEmitNegate(), lEmitOpAssign(), lEmitPrePostIncDec(), lInitSymbol(), and lProcessPrintArg().

virtual Expr* Expr::Optimize (  ) [pure virtual]

This method should perform early optimizations of the expression (constant folding, etc.) and return a pointer to the resulting expression. If an error is encountered during optimization, NULL should be returned.

Implements ASTNode.

Implemented in UnaryExpr, BinaryExpr, AssignExpr, SelectExpr, ExprList, FunctionCallExpr, IndexExpr, MemberExpr, ConstExpr, TypeCastExpr, ReferenceExpr, DereferenceExpr, SymbolExpr, FunctionSymbolExpr, and SyncExpr.

Referenced by Module::AddGlobal(), PrintStmt::Optimize(), ReturnStmt::Optimize(), ForStmt::Optimize(), DoStmt::Optimize(), IfStmt::Optimize(), DeclStmt::Optimize(), ExprStmt::Optimize(), DereferenceExpr::Optimize(), ReferenceExpr::Optimize(), TypeCastExpr::Optimize(), MemberExpr::Optimize(), IndexExpr::Optimize(), FunctionCallExpr::Optimize(), SelectExpr::Optimize(), AssignExpr::Optimize(), BinaryExpr::Optimize(), and UnaryExpr::Optimize().

virtual Expr* Expr::TypeCheck (  ) [pure virtual]

This method should perform type checking of the expression and return a pointer to the resulting expression. If an error is encountered, NULL should be returned.

Implements ASTNode.

Implemented in UnaryExpr, BinaryExpr, AssignExpr, SelectExpr, ExprList, FunctionCallExpr, IndexExpr, MemberExpr, ConstExpr, TypeCastExpr, ReferenceExpr, DereferenceExpr, SymbolExpr, FunctionSymbolExpr, and SyncExpr.

Referenced by Module::AddGlobal(), BinaryExpr::Optimize(), PrintStmt::TypeCheck(), ReturnStmt::TypeCheck(), ForStmt::TypeCheck(), DoStmt::TypeCheck(), IfStmt::TypeCheck(), DeclStmt::TypeCheck(), ExprStmt::TypeCheck(), DereferenceExpr::TypeCheck(), ReferenceExpr::TypeCheck(), TypeCastExpr::TypeCheck(), MemberExpr::TypeCheck(), IndexExpr::TypeCheck(), FunctionCallExpr::TypeCheck(), SelectExpr::TypeCheck(), AssignExpr::TypeCheck(), BinaryExpr::TypeCheck(), and UnaryExpr::TypeCheck().

Expr * Expr::TypeConv ( const Type *  type,
const char *  errorMsgBase = NULL,
bool  failureOk = false 
)

This method tries to convert the expression to the given type. In the event of failure, if the failureOk parameter is true, then no error is issued. If failureOk is false, then an error is printed that incorporates the given error message string. In either failure case, NULL is returned.
